alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 14 at 6:53PM MST until August 14 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... East central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 653 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Dateland to 14 miles southeast of Mohawk, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 34 and 66. Locations impacted include... Tacna, Mohawk and Roll. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
